log.input:
Simple Pendulum

If we define the moment of inertia (I) as:

$$
I = mr^2
$$

Since the torque $\tau$ and angular acceleration $\alpha$ are in opposite directions, their relationship is:

$$
\tau = -I\alpha \Rightarrow rF\sin\theta = -mr^2 \frac{d^2\theta}{dt^2} \Rightarrow \frac{F}{m}r\sin\theta = -\frac{d^2\theta}{dt^2}
$$

If $r = L$ and $F = mg$, and when $\theta < 5^\circ$, $\sin \theta \approx \theta$, then the equation can be rewritten as:

$$
\frac{g}{L}\theta = -\frac{d^2\theta}{dt^2}
$$

From this, we can derive:

$$
\theta(t) = \theta_0 \cos\left(\sqrt{\frac{g}{L}} t\right) = \theta_0 \cos(\omega t)
$$

In the formula above, $\omega$ is the angular frequency of the oscillation, hence the period is:

$$
T = \frac{2\pi}{\omega} = 2\pi \sqrt{\frac{L}{g}}
$$

There are two programs below:

1. An ideal simple pendulum, changing the initial swing angle to calculate the motion process and period.
2. A simple pendulum considering air resistance.

(1) Define and initialize a variable named Length_I as a cyber input variable, set Length_I=10
(2) Define and initialize a variable named Radius_I as a cyber input variable, set Radius_I=1
(3) Length_I is the length of the pendulum. When Length_I changes to a new value, the length of the pendulum also changes to that value.
(4) Radius_I is the radius of the ball. When Radius_I changes to a new value, the radius of the ball also changes to that value.
(5) Do not import packages that are not supported by VPython such as numpy, math and time
log.output:
from vpython import *

# Constants
g = 9.8
L = 10
R = 1
theta_0 = 0.1
omega = sqrt(g/L)

# Create objects
ceiling = box(pos=vector(0,0,0), length=0.2, height=0.01, width=0.2, color=color.blue)
ball = sphere(pos=vector(L*sin(theta_0), -L*cos(theta_0), 0), radius=R, color=color.red)
rod = cylinder(pos=ceiling.pos, axis=ball.pos-ceiling.pos, radius=0.01)

# Set initial values
ball.theta = theta_0
ball.omega = 0

# Time step
dt = 0.01
t = 0

# Animate the pendulum
while t < 10:
    rate(100)
    ball.omega -= g*sin(ball.theta)*dt/L
    ball.theta += ball.omega*dt
    ball.pos = vector(L*sin(ball.theta), -L*cos(ball.theta), 0)
    rod.axis = ball.pos
    t += dt

log.input:
Please update the following program based on this instruction: Please make it swing faster

Current program:
from vpython import *

# Define and initialize a variable
Length_I = 10
Radius_I = 1

# Create a pendulum
ceiling = box(length=0.2, height=0.2, width=2, color=color.blue)
ball = sphere(radius=Radius_I, color=color.red)
ball.mass = 1.0
ball.pos = vector(0, -Length_I, 0)
rod = cylinder(radius=0.01, pos=ceiling.pos, axis=ball.pos-ceiling.pos)

# Define parameters
g = 9.8
ball.theta = 1.0 
ball.p = ball.mass * sqrt(2*ball.mass*g*Length_I*(1-cos(ball.theta)))

# Define time parameters
t = 0
dt = 0.01
start = clock()

# Animation loop
while True:
    rate(100) # Maximum number of frames per second
    ball.a = vector(0, -g*cos(ball.theta), 0)
    ball.p += ball.a*dt
    ball.pos = rod.pos + Length_I*vector(sin(ball.theta), -cos(ball.theta), 0)
    rod.axis = ball.pos - rod.pos
    ball.theta = (ball.p.x*ball.theta)/(ball.mass*Length_I)
    t += dt
    if abs(ball.theta) < 0.01 and t>1: 
        print("Period = ", clock()-start, " seconds")
        break

ball.mass = 1.0

from vpython import *

# Define and initialize a variable
Length_I = 10
Radius_I = 1

# Create a pendulum
ceiling = box(length=0.2, height=0.2, width=2, color=color.blue)
ball = sphere(radius=Radius_I, color=color.red)
ball.mass = 1.0
ball.pos = vector(0, -Length_I, 0)
rod = cylinder(radius=0.01, pos=ceiling.pos, axis=ball.pos-ceiling.pos)

# Define parameters
g = 9.8
ball.theta = 1.0 
ball.p = vector(0, ball.mass * sqrt(2*ball.mass*g*Length_I*(1-cos(ball.theta))), 0)

# Define time parameters
t = 0
dt = 0.005
start = clock()

# Animation loop
while True:
    rate(200) # Maximum number of frames per second
    ball.a = vector(0, -g*cos(ball.theta), 0)
    ball.p = ball.p + ball.a*dt
    ball.pos = rod.pos + Length_I*vector(sin(ball.theta), -cos(ball.theta), 0)
    rod.axis = ball.pos - rod.pos
    ball.theta = atan(ball.p.y/ball.p.x)
    t += dt
    if abs(ball.theta) < 0.01 and t>1: 
        print("Period = ", clock()-start, " seconds")
        break

from vpython import *

# Define and initialize a variable
Length_I = 10
Radius_I = 1

# Create a pendulum
ceiling = box(length=0.2, height=0.2, width=2, color=color.blue)
ball = sphere(radius=Radius_I, color=color.red)
ball.mass = 1.0
ball.pos = vector(0, -Length_I, 0)
rod = cylinder(radius=0.01, pos=ceiling.pos, axis=ball.pos-ceiling.pos)

# Define parameters
g = 9.8
ball.theta = 1.0 
ball.p = vector(0, ball.mass * sqrt(2*ball.mass*g*Length_I*(1-cos(ball.theta))),0)

# Define time parameters
t = 0
dt = 0.005
start = clock()

# Animation loop
while True:
    rate(200) # Maximum number of frames per second
    ball.a = vector(0, -g*cos(ball.theta), 0)
    ball.p.y = ball.p.y + ball.a.y*dt
    ball.pos = rod.pos + Length_I*vector(sin(ball.theta), -cos(ball.theta), 0)
    rod.axis = ball.pos - rod.pos
    ball.theta = (mag(ball.p)*ball.theta)/(ball.mass*Length_I)
    t += dt
    if abs(ball.theta) < 0.01 and t>1: 
        print("Period = ", clock()-start, " seconds")
        break

from vpython import *

# Define and initialize a variable
Length_I = 10
Radius_I = 1

# Create a pendulum
ceiling = box(length=0.2, height=0.2, width=2, color=color.blue)
ball = sphere(radius=Radius_I, color=color.red)
ball.mass = 1.0
ball.pos = vector(0, -Length_I, 0)
rod = cylinder(radius=0.01, pos=ceiling.pos, axis=ball.pos-ceiling.pos)

# Define parameters
g = 9.8
ball.theta = 1.0 
ball.p = ball.mass * sqrt(2*ball.mass*g*Length_I*(1-cos(ball.theta)))

# Define time parameters
t = 0
dt = 0.005
start = clock()

# Animation loop
while True:
    rate(200) # Maximum number of frames per second
    ball.a = vector(0, -ball.mass * g * cos(ball.theta), 0)
    ball.p = ball.p + ball.a*dt
    ball.pos = rod.pos + Length_I*vector(sin(ball.theta), -cos(ball.theta), 0)
    rod.axis = ball.pos - rod.pos
    ball.theta = atan2(ball.p.y,ball.p.x)
    t += dt
    if abs(ball.theta) < 0.01 and t>1: 
        print("Period = ", clock()-start, " seconds")
        break

from vpython import *

# Define and initialize a variable
Length_I = 10
Radius_I = 1

# Create a pendulum
ceiling = box(length=0.2, height=0.2, width=2, color=color.blue)

ball.mass = 1.0
ball.pos = vector(0, -Length_I, 0)
rod = cylinder(radius=0.01, pos=ceiling.pos, axis=ball.pos-ceiling.pos)

# Define parameters
g = 9.8
ball.theta = 1.0 
ball.p = ball.mass * sqrt(2*ball.mass*g*Length_I*(1-cos(ball.theta)))

# Define time parameters
t = 0
dt = 0.005
start = clock()

# Animation loop
while True:
    rate(200) # Maximum number of frames per second
    ball.a = vector(0, -g*cos(ball.theta), 0)
    ball.p = ball.p + ball.a*dt
    ball.pos = rod.pos + Length_I*vector(sin(ball.theta), -cos(ball.theta), 0)
    rod.axis = ball.pos - rod.pos
    ball.theta = atan(ball.p.y/ball.p.x)
    t += dt
    if abs(ball.theta) < 0.01 and t>1: 
        print("Period = ", clock()-start, " seconds")
        break
